result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Rottmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. No Huber requested with credit for 57 days time served.

miscConds.notes: -Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school.
- The defendant is advised of a lifetime ban of firearms.

-No contact with victim ASK.
-Defendant is allowed contact with MFJR, the child he is the adjudicated father.
-Defendant is allowed contact with BDLR when he is determined to be the adjudicated father.

-Participate in a Batter's Intervention.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety with random testing.

-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation and domestic abuse assessments, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 2. No Huber requested.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Rottmann

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael James Rottmann in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court for Michael James Rottmann.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and efiled.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed. and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to Count 1:
- Serve 200 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  No Huber requested with credit for 57 days time served.
As to Count 2: 
- Court sentenced the defendant to serve 70 days in the House of Correction; consecutive to Count 2.  No Huber requested.  

Court STAYED sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation and domestic abuse assessments, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school
-No contact with victim ASK
-participate in a Batter's Intervention 
-parenting classes
-absolute sobriety with random testing
-defendant is allowed contact with MFJR, the child he is the adjudicated father
-defendant is allowed contact with BDLR when he is determined to be the adjudicated father

The defendant is advised of a lifetime ban of firearms.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email to schedule PROMPT DISPOSITION hearing. 
Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON before Judge Dee, Branch 37. 
Court vacated Scheduling Conference date.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed/

Defendant Michael James Rottmann not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court for Michael James Rottmann.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and needs an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ASK (DOB: 04/20/1998)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Michael James Rottmann appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Michael James Rottmann.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael James Rottmann
Current: 5105 S 27th St Unit 17, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 2112 South 76th Street, West Allis, WI 53219
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
